description: Move you camera until white dots will display in your screen. Touch at any white dots to start your learning!
Building on our discussion about the 'Butterfly Effect' in ecosystems, let's test
your understanding of how changes in one population can impact others!
Imagine a forest ecosystem teeming with life: squirrels, hawks, oak trees, and
mushrooms all play crucial roles in this balanced community. However, unexpected events can disrupt this harmony.
Read each scenario carefully and choose the answer that best describes the likely
consequences for other populations in the forest ecosystem.
A harsh winter kills off a significant portion of the oak tree population
What is the most likely impact on the hawk population?
choices: Decrease due to lack of prey
Increase due to decreased competition for prey
answer: Decrease due to lack of prey

description: A new predator, the red fox, is introduced to the forest
What is the most likely impact on the squirrel population?
choices: Remain stable, adapted to avoid predators.

description: A disease outbreak significantly reduces the population of squirrels
What is the most likely impact on the mushroom population?
choices: Decrease due to lack of dead squirrel bodies to decompose
Increase due to reduced number of squirrels
answer: Increase due to reduced number of squirrels
